perturbation.original_text: 1.2 The term "Confidential Information" means all know-how, formulations, recipes, specifications, catalogs, books, price books, maintenance,  parts and service manuals, data sheets, sales, service and technical bulletins, customer lists, sales and marketing programs, price lists, cost data,  sales aids, such as filmstrips and recordings, and all other publications and information, whether or not reduced to writing, relating to the  formulation, manufacture, use, marketing and sale of the AuraGen and/or the Products, as well as any other information which may be divulged by  one party under this Agreement to the other in the course of its performance of this Agreement, which is marked as Confidential or which is  disclosed under circumstances that reasonably place the recipient on notice of the confidentiality of the information. Confidential Information does  not, however, include any information which the recipient can establish (i) was publicly known and made generally available in the public domain  prior to the time of disclosure by the discloser; (ii) becomes publicly known and made generally available after disclosure by the discloser to  recipient through no fault or breach of recipient; (iii) is already in the possession of recipient without restriction on use or disclosure at the time of  disclosure by discloser as shown by recipient's files and records prior to the time of the
perturbation.changed_text: 1.2 The term "Confidential Information" means some of know-how, formulations, recipes, specifications, catalogs, books, price books, maintenance,  parts and service manuals, data sheets, sales, service and technical bulletins, customer lists, sales and marketing programs, price lists, cost data,  sales aids, such as filmstrips and recordings, and all other publications and information, whether or not reduced to writing, relating to the  formulation, manufacture, use, marketing and sale of the AuraGen and/or the Products, as well as any other information which may be divulged by  one party under this Agreement to the other in the course of its performance of this Agreement, whether or not it is marked as Confidential or which is  disclosed under circumstances regardless of whether the recipient is placed on notice of the confidentiality of the information. Confidential Information does  not, however, include any information which the recipient can establish (i) was never publicly known and made generally available in the public domain  prior to the time of disclosure by the discloser; (ii) becomes publicly known and made generally available after disclosure by the discloser to  recipient due to the fault or breach of recipient; (iii) is already not in the possession of recipient without restriction on use or disclosure at the time of  disclosure by discloser as shown by recipient's files and records prior to the time of the
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Confidential Information' is altered to be inconsistent with common legal interpretations and best practices. By changing 'all know-how' to 'some of know-how' and removing the requirement for explicit marking or reasonable notice for information to be confidential, it creates uncertainty about what exactly constitutes confidential information. Additionally, changing exceptions (i), (ii), and (iii) to their opposite cases leads to uncertainty about what constitutes confidential information, as previously agreed upon.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Trade Secrets Law, common law principles regarding confidential information

perturbation.original_text: 3.7 End-User Warranty. At all times during the Term of this Agreement, Zanotti shall warrant the Products to purchasers of AETRU Systems in  accordance with the terms of its standard warranty attached hereto as Exhibit "C"  ("End User Warranty"), as such End User Warranty may be  modified from time to time by Zanotti, provided however that at no time shall such End User Warranty provide for a warranty coverage period of  less than thirty-six (36) months from the time of purchase by the initial end-user. A copy of the End User Warranty shall be included as part of the  packaging included with all Product delivered to Aura and Aura shall distribute each Product with all warranty cards, a copy of the End User  Warranty and all other
perturbation.changed_text: 3.7 End-User Warranty. At all times during the Term of this Agreement, Zanotti may warrant the Products to purchasers of AETRU Systems at Zanotti's discretion, and the warranty terms may be subject to verbal agreements between Zanotti and the end-user.  Such End User Warranty may be  modified from time to time by Zanotti, however that at no time should such End User Warranty provide for a warranty coverage period of  less than twelve (12) months from the time of purchase by the initial end-user. A copy of the End User Warranty may not be included as part of the  packaging included with all Product delivered to Aura, and Aura may distribute each Product without any warranty cards or a copy of the End User  Warranty and all other
perturbation.explanation: The modification changes 'shall warrant' to 'may warrant', making the warranty discretionary. The removal of the requirement to include a copy of the End User Warranty creates a contradiction and uncertainty, as the existence and terms of the warranty are now unclear and unenforceable. Also, the period for warranty decreased from 'thirty-six (36) months' to 'twelve (12) months'.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Warranty law (UCC Article 2), consumer protection laws

perturbation.original_text: 8.6 Applicable Law. This Agreement is deemed made and entered into in the State of California and shall be construed, enforced and performed in  accordance with the laws of the State of California, without reference, to choice of law.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.6 Applicable Law. This Agreement is deemed made and entered into in the State of California and shall be construed, enforced and performed in  accordance with the laws of any state the parties agree to after a dispute arises, without reference, to choice of law.
perturbation.explanation: The change allows the applicable law to be determined after a dispute arises, which contradicts standard legal practice and creates uncertainty about which laws govern the contract. California law has already been chosen to govern and modify it creates conflicts.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles of certainty and predictability, conflict of laws
